sen.j: 破籠（わりご）とはヒノキなどの白木を薄くはいだ板で作られた運搬用食器の一種。
sen.e: Warigo is a kind of portable tableware which is made up of thinly stripped plain wood boards such as hinoki (Japanese cypress).
Warigo is a kind of portable tableware which is made of thinly stripped plain wood boards such as hinoki (Japanese cypress).
sen.cmt: made up of→made ofに変更しました。
sen.e: Warigo is a kind of portable tableware which is made of thinly stripped plain wood boards such as hinoki (Japanese cypress).

sen.j: 平安時代から日本で使用されていた。
sen.e: In Japan it has been used since Heian period.
In Japan it has been used since the Heian period.
sen.cmt: Heian period→the Heian periodに変更しました。
sen.e: In Japan it has been used since the Heian period.
Warigo (破籠) also can be written as 破子.
Warigo (破籠) also can be written as 破子.
Warigo (破籠) also can be written as 破子.

sen.j: 折り箱のような食器で、なかに仕切りがありふたがついている。
sen.e: This tableware is like an Oribako (small box for food, made of thin sheets of wood or cardboard), and has two partitions in it.
This tableware is like an Oribako (a small box for food, made of thin sheets of wood or cardboard), and has partitions in it and a lid.
sen.cmt: has two partitionsは誤訳のためtwoを削除し、「ふたがついている」の部分を追加しました。
sen.e: This tableware is like an Oribako (a small box for food, made of thin sheets of wood or cardboard), and has partitions in it and a lid.

sen.j: ふたは一枚板か、かぶせぶた、円形、四角形など様々のものが作られていた。
sen.e: Various types of lids are available such as Solid timber, covering lid, round shape lid, square lid.
Various types of lids are available such as solid wood, covering lids, round shape lids and square lids.
Various types of lids are available such as solid wood, covering lids, round shape lids and square lids.

sen.j: 一度使うと捨てるもので、弁当や食べ物を運ぶために使われた。
sen.e: It is one-way container, and used as a lunch box or to take along food.
It is a one-way container, and used as a lunch box or to take along food.
It is a one-way container, and used as a lunch box or to take along food.
History
History
History

sen.j: 『源氏物語』にも桧破籠（ひわりご）として現れており、また『和名類聚抄』にも記述されている。
sen.e: It appears in "Tale of Genji" as a hiwarigo lunch box (a partitioned wooden lunch box) and also in "Wamyo Ruijusho" (dictionary of Japanese names).
It appears in "The Tale of Genji" as a hiwarigo lunch box (a partitioned wooden lunch box) and also in "Wamyo Ruijusho" (a dictionary of Japanese names).
sen.cmt: Tale of Genji→The Tale of Genjiに変更しました。Dictionaryの前に冠詞を補いました。
sen.e: It appears in "The Tale of Genji" as a hiwarigo lunch box (a partitioned wooden lunch box) and also in "Wamyo Ruijusho" (a dictionary of Japanese names).

sen.j: 現代でも小豆島の農村歌舞伎などで、わりご弁当という形で残っている。
sen.e: In modern age, it still survives as a warigo lunch box in Noson kabuki (Farmers' Kabuki) in Shodo-shima Island.
It still survives as a warigo lunch box in Noson kabuki (farmers' kabuki) in Shodo-shima Island.
sen.cmt: In modern ageを削除しました。
sen.e: It still survives as a warigo lunch box in Noson kabuki (farmers' kabuki) in Shodo-shima Island.
